column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////Regarding your seating experience
column2: I have been in the restaurant industry for nearly 25 years
column3: and I can honestly say there is absolutely no perfect method for seating guests. Every scenario must be handled on a case-by-case basis
column4: and there may have been other factors at play such as the host attempting to accommodate a large
column5: incomplete party with a pending arrival
column6: or re-seating guests who have requested a move from one section to another. We also very often get requests from families with small children who require high chairs that only want to be seated at a table. Regardless
column7: I will use your constructive feedback as a teachable moment for my entire front of house staff.
